title: Suicide Risk Prediction Modeling for Patients with Substance Use Disorders

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Self-directed learning via BYOD using video lectures, programming practice materials, and datasets provided through LMS. Learning progress is monitored through weekly assignments and monthly quizzes

learning_goals: They can design and implement machine learning models (decision trees, random forests) to predict suicide risk in patients with substance use disorders.
They can analyze gender/age interaction effects in medical datasets to derive risk factor combinations.
They can identify the top five variables influencing suicide risk prediction using model interpretation techniques.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
